column1: Type    Item    Q_type  Deviation   Narrative   Q_1 Q_2 Q_3
SA_1fb  1   0 Sally and Anne are playing. Sally has a box and Anne has a basket
column2: and there is a ball. Sally puts the ball in her box. Then Sally goes to play somewhere else. Anne takes the ball from Sally's box and she puts the ball in her own basket. Anne also goes to play somewhere else for a while. Then Sally returns.    Where is the ball now?  Where does Sally look for the ball?  Why?

column1: SA_1fb  1   2   Peter and Kumar are playing. They found a beautiful golden marble. They dig a hole in the ground to hide the marble. Then Peter has to go home
column2: so he leaves. Kumar stays a bit longer. When he sees a dog approaching
column3: he realizes the marble is not safe. He digs up the marble and puts it in a hole in the tree. Then Kumar goes home. The next day Peter returns to the playground. He wants to play with the marble again.   Where is the marble now?    Where does Peter look for the marble?   Why?

column1: SA_2fb  2   0  Sally and Anne are in the park. There is an ice cream truck next to the fountain. They both want to buy an ice cream but Sally doesn't have enough money. Sally goes home to get more money. The ice cream man tells Anne that he is moving
column2: he is now going to sell ice cream at the swing. He meets Sally on the way and tells her where he is going. Sally gets money and so goes to the swing to buy an ice cream. Anne goes to Sally's house and asks Sally's mother where Sally is. The mother says that Sally is buying ice cream.  Where is the ice cream truck now?    Where does Anne think Sally is going to look for the ice cream truck?   Why?

column1: SA_2fb  2   2   Tom and Gerald went swimming. But when they wanted to go home
column2: Tom found out that his bike has a flat tire. When they start walking they see the swimming teacher passing in his car. They put up their hand and the swimming teacher stops the car at the bus stop alongside the road. They ask whether they can hitchhike
column3: the swimming teacher says yes. Tom says he forgot his bag in the dressing room
column4: so he quickly runs to grab it. The swimming teacher says to Gerald that he'll park his car in the parking lot around the corner
column5: so they can put the bikes in the trunk. On the way to the parking lot the swimming teacher sees Tom and tells him where he is going. So when Tom has his bag
column6: he walks to the parking lot. Gerald walks to the dressing room and asks where Tom is. The children in the dressing room say that Tom went to the car of the swimming teacher.    Where is the swimming teacher’s car now?    Where does Gerald think Tom is going to look for the swimming teacher’s car?    Why?

column1: SS_1lie 3   0   One day
column2: when Jan walks into the house
column3: he accidentally knocks over his mother's favourite vase. The vase is broken. Oh no! If mom finds out about this
column4: she will be very angry! When Jan's mother comes home and sees the broken vase
column5: she asks Jan what happened. Jan says: The dog knocked it over
column6: it is not my fault!    Is what Jan says true?  Why does Jan say this?

column1: SS_1lie 3   2   One day
column2: Olga is playing with the doll of her little sister Sally. Accidentally she pulls the head from the doll. She tries to attach it to the body
column3: but without success. It looks like the doll is broken! When Sally sees this
column4: she will be mad. It was her favourite doll. Sally comes home and searches for her doll. When she finds it she asks Olga if she knows why her doll is broken. Olga says: Mummy broke it while she was cleaning up!   Is what Olga says true? Why does Olga say this?

column1: SS_2pretend 4   0   Sally and Anne are playing in the house. Sally takes a banana from the fruit bowl and holds it to her ear. She says to Anne: 'Look
column2: the banana is a telephone!' Is what Sally says true?    Why does Sally say this?

column1: SS_2pretend 4   2   Peter and Kumar are on the playground. Peter lies down on the floor
column2: with his arms stuck to his body. He says: 'Look
column3: I am a snake!'    Is what Peter says true?    Why does Peter say this?

column1: SS_3joke    5   0   James goes to Claire's house for the first time. He goes there for a drink and wants to see Claire's dog whom she always talks about. James likes dogs very much. When James gets to Claire's house
column2: Claire runs to the door to open it
column3: and her dog jumps up to greet James. Claire's dog is huge
column4: and almost as tall as James! When James sees Claire's big dog he says
column6: you don't have a dog at all. You have an elephant!   Is what James says true?    Why does James say this?

column1: SS_3joke    5   2   Robin just woke up and is putting on his clothes. He is almost done. When he grabs his pants he decides not to put them on. He goes down stairs and walks into the kitchen. He says to his mother: Look mom
column2: I am Donald Duck!    Is what Robin says true?  Why does Robin say this?

column1: SS_4whitelie    6  0    Tineke has been looking forward to Christmas all year
column2: because she knew she could ask her parents for a rabbit. Tineke really wants to have a rabbit. It was finally Christmas
column3: and Tineke hurried to open the big package her parents had given her. She was sure it would contain a rabbit in a cage. But when she opened the package
column4: with the whole family gathered around her
column5: she saw that there were only a few old books inside. That is not what she wished for. However
column6: when her parents asked her what she thought of her Christmas present
column8: I think it's a nice present
column9: thank you. It's exactly what I wanted.    Is what Tineke says true?   Why does Tineke say this?

column1: SS_4whitelie    6   2   Synthia was on a holiday with her parents. She brought her friend Linda. Linda and Synthia made friends with some other children in the holiday resort. Synthia really liked one of the boys
column2: Tim. She talked about him all the time and she was really shy when he came near. At the end of the holiday
column3: they played with the other children one more time. When Synthia went on the swing
column7: she jumped off. But she didn't see her skirt got stuck in the swing and it ripped. Synthia quickly ran away
column8: back to their bungalow. When they were in the car back home
column9: Synthia asked to Linda: Do you think Tim saw anything? At the moment Synthia jumped from the swing
column11: and they both saw that happened. However
column13: I don't think Tim saw anything! Is what Linda says true? Why does Linda say this?

column1: SS_5misunderstanding    7   0   A burglar just stole from a store. He tries to flee. While running home
column2: a police officer sees that he just dropped a glove. The police officer does not know that the man is a burglar. All he wants to say is that the burglar dropped his glove. But when the police officer yells at the burglar: Hey
column5: sees the police officer and surrenders. He raises his hands and admits to have stolen from the store nearby.  Is the police officer surprised when he hears what the burglar says?    Why does the burglar surrender and admit his crime
column6: when the police officer just wanted to give him back his glove?

column1: SS_5misunderstanding    7   2   The teacher doesn't allow Sanne to play soccer until she has completed all her assignments. But she doesn't feel like doing those assignments at all! She secretly goes to the storage room to get the ball. The school director comes by
column2: he sees that Sanne cannot reach the ball. He doesn't know that she has to finish her assignments first. The director just wants to help Sanne get the ball. He asks
column3: Are you okay? Sanne is afraid
column4: she thinks she has been caught. She says
column5: Sorry! I'll do my assignments first...  Is the director surprised when he hears what Sanne says?    Why does Sanne say this
column6: when the director only wanted to help her?

column1: SS_6sarcasm 8   0   Bram's mother cooked for a very long time to make Bram's favorite dish: fish and chips. But when she brings it to Bram
column2: he is watching TV. He doesn't even look up or say thank you. Bram's mother is angry and says
column3: Well that's very nice! That's what I call politeness!   Is it true what Bram’s mother says? Why does Bram's mother say this?

column1: SS_6sarcasm 8   2   Kim promised her father to help clean the kitchen. She first cleaned the sink and then all the doors of the cabinets. She thought it would be a good idea to also clean the cabinets from the inside. When she opened one of them
column2: a pack flour fell out of it on the ground. It exploded and flour was everywhere. At that point
column3: Kim's father entered the kitchen. He said: Wow
column4: everything is so clean now!  Is it true what Kim's father says?  Why does Kim’s father say this?

column1: SS7_dubblebluff 9   0   During the war
column2: the Red Army kidnaps someone from the Blue Army. They want the prisoner to tell them where his army's tanks are. The Red Army knows they must be either by the sea or by the mountains. The Red Army also knows that whoever they kidnapped doesn't want to say anything because he wants to save his own Blue Army. So the prisoner will surely lie to them. The prisoner is very smart and brave and does not want to let them find the tanks. The tanks are in the mountains. The Red Army asks the prisoner where the tanks are. He says
column3: They are in the mountains.    Is it true what the prisoner says?  Why does the prisoner say this?

column1: SS7_dubblebluff 9   2   Jip plays hide and seek with his friends. He has to quickly choose where to hide
column2: behind the tree or the shed. If Jip is found immediately
column3: he has lost. You can hide better behind the shed
column4: so that's the best place. But whoever has to look for him probably thinks so too. Jip is very smart: he hides behind the shed after all!  Where does Jip hide?    Jip realizes that the others will also think that the shed is the best place. Why does he hide behind it?

column1: H_1 13  I   3   Meet Sam and Helen. Sam just moved here. Helen: Hi
column2: you're Sam
column4: I'm in the same class as you. Sam: Oh
column5: hey Helen! How are you? Helen: Fine thanks. Are you settling in OK? Sam: Yeah I'm gradually finding my way around
column7: you don't happen to know where I can find the nearest store to buy some post stamps? I need to send a card to my granny. Helen: Oh
column8: that's sweet of you. Sam: Yeah but it’s her birthday tomorrow and I can't see her myself
column9: so I'm kind of worried that it’s not going to get there on time. So I really need to send it today but I don't know where to find a store nearby. Helen: Uhm
column10: I think there is one on Chestnut Street
column11: so if you go down to the end of this street and turn left
column12: then it's about half a block down on the left. Sam: Thanks! Helen: No problem. Here’s Sam again. Later Sam meets his friend Pete. Sam: Hi Pete
column13: how are you? Pete: Oh hi Sam how are you? Sam: Yeah
column14: I'm OK. Pete: You don't sound so happy. What's up? Sam: Oh
column15: I'm just a bit annoyed. I was really hoping to send a card to my granny
column16: so I was looking for a store where they would sell post stamps. So I asked Helen
column18: right? She is in our class. Pete: Yeah
column20: I asked Helen where I could buy post stamps. She told me there was a store on Chestnut Street. But when I got there
column21: there was a big sign on the door saying it had moved to Bold Street. So I raced over to Bold Street
column22: but I didn't make it on time
column23: the store was already closed. Pete: No way! Sam: Yeah. So now my granny won't get her birthday card on time and I know she'll be really disappointed. Sam: Hey
column24: I've heard that Helen is a bit of a joker. Do you think she would send me to the wrong place on purpose? Pete: Well
column25: did she know how important it was to send the card today? Sam: Yeah I told her it was for granny's birthday tomorrow. Pete: Then I think she probably wouldn't have been deliberately trying to trick you. It was probably an honest mistake. Pete: I thought Helen didn't know that the store had moved. Is this correct?

column1: H_3 20  M   2   Meet Hannah. She is late for the lunch break and when she comes in
column2: all the places are taken. Then
column3: she discovers there is a free chair next to Ama and her boyfriend
column6: can I sit here? Ama: Oh actually
column7: I was saving that seat for Abi. Hannah: Oh
column8: okay. Ama: Sorry! Hannah meets Carolyn. Hannah: Hey Carolyn
column9: can I sit here? Carolyn: Sure. Carolyn: Hey are you OK? You look a bit upset. Hannah: Yeah I'm alright
column10: it's just that Ama is so mean sometimes. Carolyn: What happened? Hannah: Well
column11: I came in to lunch a bit late
column12: and there were hardly any seats left
column13: but when I asked if I could sit at the table with her and Matthias and their friends
column14: Ama said she was saving the seat for Abi! Carolyn: So? Ama and Abi always save seats for each other. Hannah: But Abi went home sick this morning! So Ama couldn't have been saving the seat for her. She was just making up an excuse. Hannah: I think the real reason that she didn't want me to sit with them is that she's jealous. She thinks her boyfriend Matthias has a crush on me
column15: but it isn't true! Carolyn: Well
column16: I didn't know that Abi was off sick. I was in a rehearsal all morning
column19: so she probably didn't know either that Abi had gone home. Carolyn: Besides
column20: we sat with her and Matthias at lunch yesterday and that didn't bother her. So I don't think she's jealous of you.  Carolyn: When Hannah sat down with me
column21: I immediately saw something was wrong
column22: so I asked her what was up.
